co.poynt.os.services.v1

Interface IPoyntOrderService

  • All Superinterfaces:
    android.os.IInterface
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    IPoyntOrderService.Stub

    public interface IPoyntOrderService
extends android.os.IInterface
    Provides necessary interfaces to create and manage Orders. All operations require network connectivity except for the 'get' operations, in which case, data from the local Poynt Orders content providerName is returned. Poynt Order content providerName is updated whenever the orders are modified locally or on the cloud. All calls require the necessary permissions declared in the caller's Android Manifest file. Please refer to Poynt OS Permissions for more details.
    Since:
    1.0-beta2

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  IPoyntOrderService.Stub
      Local-side IPC implementation stub class.

        asBinder

    • Method Detail

      • saveOrder

        void saveOrder(co.poynt.api.model.Order order,
               java.lang.String requestId,
               IPoyntOrderServiceListener callback)
        throws android.os.RemoteException
        Saves the given order in local Poynt Order content provider. This interface only creates the order locally and does not sync with cloud. If no order->id is set, it will be assigned one, which will be returned in the response callback.
        Parameters:
        order - co.poynt.api.Order
        requestId - RequestId for Idempotency enforcement
        callback - IPoyntOrderServiceListener
        Throws:
        android.os.RemoteException

      • createOrder

        void createOrder(co.poynt.api.model.Order order,
                 java.lang.String requestId,
                 IPoyntOrderServiceListener callback)
          throws android.os.RemoteException
        Creates the order in Poynt Cloud and also saves the created order in Poynt Order content providerName. This interface only creates the order and does not process any payment transactions (if any) specified in the Order object.
        Parameters:
        order - co.poynt.api.Order
        requestId - RequestId for Idempotency enforcement
        callback - IPoyntOrderServiceListener
        Throws:
        android.os.RemoteException

      • processOrder

        void processOrder(co.poynt.api.model.Order order,
                  java.lang.String requestId,
                  IPoyntOrderServiceListener callback)
           throws android.os.RemoteException
        Processes the given order through Poynt Cloud and also saves the processed order in local Poynt Order content providerName. This interface processes any payment transactions specified in the Order object.
        Parameters:
        order - co.poynt.api.Order
        requestId - RequestId for Idempotency enforcement
        callback - IPoyntOrderServiceListener
        Throws:
        android.os.RemoteException

      • cancelOrder

        void cancelOrder(java.lang.String orderId,
                 java.lang.String requestId,
                 IPoyntOrderServiceListener callback)
          throws android.os.RemoteException
        Cancels the given order through Poynt Cloud and also updates the order in local Poynt Order content providerName. This interface refunds or voids any transactions that are part of the original Order.
        Parameters:
        order - co.poynt.api.Order
        requestId - RequestId for Idempotency enforcement
        callback - IPoyntOrderServiceListener
        Throws:
        android.os.RemoteException

      • captureOrder

        void captureOrder(java.lang.String orderId,
                  co.poynt.api.model.Order order,
                  java.lang.String requestId,
                  IPoyntOrderServiceListener callback)
           throws android.os.RemoteException
        Captures the payment transactions associated with the given order through Poynt Cloud and also updates the order in local Poynt Order content providerName. When partial payment captures are required, an order object with the partial capture information can be passed as an argument. When only orderId is provided, the payments are captured completely.
        Parameters:
        orderId - ID of the order to capture
        order - co.poynt.api.Order
        requestId - RequestId for Idempotency enforcement
        callback - IPoyntOrderServiceListener
        Throws:
        android.os.RemoteException

      • completeOrder

        void completeOrder(java.lang.String orderId,
                   co.poynt.api.model.Order order,
                   java.lang.String requestId,
                   IPoyntOrderServiceListener callback)
            throws android.os.RemoteException
        Captures the payment transactions associated with the given order and marks the oder as Completed. Order is processed through Poynt Cloud and also updated in the local Poynt Order content providerName. When partial payment captures are required, an order object with the partial capture information can be passed as an argument. When only orderId is provided, the payments are captured completely.
        Parameters:
        orderId - ID of the order to capture
        order - co.poynt.api.Order - if not null and order.getContext().getSource equals to TransactionSource.WEB the server will mark order items as FULFILLED
        requestId - RequestId for Idempotency enforcement
        callback - IPoyntOrderServiceListener
        Throws:
        android.os.RemoteException

      • getOrder

        void getOrder(java.lang.String orderId,
              java.lang.String requestId,
              IPoyntOrderServiceListener callback)
       throws android.os.RemoteException
        Retrieves the given order from the local Poynt Order content providerName if available, otherwise fetches from the Poynt Cloud .
        Parameters:
        orderId - ID of the order to retrieve
        requestId - RequestId for tracking the request
        callback - IPoyntOrderServiceListener
        Throws:
        android.os.RemoteException

      • updateOrder

        void updateOrder(java.lang.String orderId,
                 co.poynt.api.model.Order order,
                 java.lang.String requestId,
                 IPoyntOrderServiceListener callback)
          throws android.os.RemoteException
        Updates the given order in the Poynt Cloud and updates local Poynt Order content providerName.
        Parameters:
        orderId - ID of the order to update
        order - Order
        requestId - RequestId for Idempotency enforcement
        callback - IPoyntOrderServiceListener
        Throws:
        android.os.RemoteException
